red.line: He told me that there was another river--“over there, short river, sweet water, red and blue.” I was interested in this and anxious to see if I had understood, so I showed him a red and blue pencil I carried, and asked again.

pink.line: There it was, about four miles off, the same town, we concluded, unless, as Jeff ventured, they all had pink houses.

pink.line: Very few men were left alive, save the slaves; and these now seized their opportunity, rose in revolt, killed their remaining masters even to the youngest boy, killed the old women too, and the mothers, intending to take possession of the country with the remaining young women and girls.
There were many of them, and but few of these would-be masters, so the young women, instead of submitting, rose in sheer desperation and slew their brutal conquerors.

red.line: Ellador was brown: hair dark and soft, like a seal coat; clear brown skin with a healthy red in it; brown eyes--all the way from topaz to black velvet they seemed to range--splendid girls, all of them.

blue.line: But so far only Celis, her blue eyes swimming in happy tears, her heart lifted with that tide of race-motherhood which was their supreme passion, could with ineffable joy and pride announce that she was to be a mother.
